newsitem.title: GERMANY: Merck gets liquid crystal patent in U.S.
newsitem.headline: Merck gets liquid crystal patent in U.S.

text.p: German drugs and chemicals group Merck KGaA said on Thursday that it had patented a new technology in the U.S. but that this invention would make little impact on results.
The group has patented technology in the field of liquid crystals which allows viewing of computer screens, televisions screens or even billboards from a new angle.
The patent runs to the year 2013.

"Technologically this is a remarkable breakthrough but considering that the liquid crystals market is rather small, the invention will make little difference on results," a Merck spokesman said answering a query.
Merck said a variety of companies, including computer manufacturers and television producers, would also be able to benefit from this new technology.
